p.s: The article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't written by John Worne was published in The Telegraph on the 27th January 2015 deals with dropingdropping rates of UK students learning foreign languages.
J. Worne uses persuasive techniques and stylistic devices to achieve a change in people willing to learn foreign languages.
Throughout his text he uses many persuasivpersuasive techniques and stilisticstylistic devices.
He starts in the title which he repeats in the first sentence can't, won't, don't which he puts in context with the national view on speaking foreign languages.
Worne shows how childish their behavior is and that they need to grow up and deal with it.
another persuasivpersuasive technique he uses is that he is referingreferring to many statistics which strengthen his point.

Another important role in convincing the readers is his use of language he uses a normal and parts informal language which is important due to the target audience he tries to address, Young people in schools or university and mainly parents of those.
Worne uses ironic to weaken an argument against him and in conclusion strengthening his point.

Important is that this is the only point against him he names by only naming this one and especially packed in ironic he wants to eliminate any doubts in his points and this one sidedone-sided argumentation is for convincinconvincing the people who already agree with his opinion to decnd change something and not to convince new people of his point.
In the entire article Worne uses inclusive pronouns.
It'sIts effect is to include the reader and convince him to do some thing and keep their attention.
Another important technique he uses is the repetition in line 27 The tough reality in a tough job market.
It addresses to the beginning where he points out the behavior of the UK's people as childish and now he gives parents like sentences which helps him to convey his point.

To conclude my analysis I would say John Worne used persuasivpersuasive techniqestechniques and devisesdevices to convince people to learn other languages but I have to add that also his use of language is important for that.
